title: What are the characteristics of external criticism? - Quora

response.answer_text: Internal criticism uses criteria that are explicit or implicit in the object of criticism, principles of evaluation that are accepted or endorsed by that view. External criticism uses criteria that aren’t contained within the object of criticism. At its best, external criticism proposes criteria that are thought to be “friendly,” i.e., would likely be accepted by the view in question if considered; at its worst, external criticism dogmatically uses criteria that would be rejected by the view—it comes as an enemy, not a friend.
